bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, August 26, 1921

div1.p: Hanson credits the success against yellow fever in Peru to Carter's advice. Yellow fever has been reported in British Honduras and Belize

August 26, 1921
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
We have received a letter from Doctor Hanson
written on the way to Panama in which he says:

“Before closing I wish to ask you to tell
Doctor Carter that I consider our success
this year is due to the advice and instructions
received from him last year.”

We have since received a cable that Doctor Hanson
sailed for Chiclayo on August 25. He plans to go ashore
in Paita to make an inspection of conditions. From there
he will continue his inspections from Chiclayo as far south
as Lima, inspecting all points of importance.

You will be interested in a letter just received
from Doctor White, dated August 9, copy of which I enclose.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Florence M. Read
Assistant Secretary Doctor Henry R Carter
New Glasgow Post Office
Amherst County
Virginia
